item.title: Efficient allocation of resources
item.description: Allocation of resources (staff and money) is essential not only to the efficiency but also to the fairness of public sector services.

item.title: Measurement of performance
item.description: What gets measured gets done. Or does it?

item.title: Flawless Consulting
item.description: Consulting is about objectively analyzing an organzation and implementing lasting change. In the best cases, the consultant teaches a client to solve future problems independently through a deeper understanding of the organizationâ€™s work and managerial roles

item.title: Benchmarking
item.description: Benchmarking is a managerial tool that improves performance by identifying and applying best documented practices. Modern benchmarking builds on comprehensive analysis of multiple-input, multiple-output relations estimated from actual practices.

item.title: Justice sector
item.description: Well-functioning judicial systems are the backbone of prospering economies. There is substantial theoretical and empirical support for the claim that court performance has a crucial overall impact on society.

item.title: Educational sector
item.description: Improving student’s skills has the potential to bring immense value to societies.

item.title: Local governments
item.description: In many countries, local governments provide an increasing share of the welfare services citizens receive. For this reason, the quality and the efficiency of local government services is very important.

item.title: Predictive Analytics
item.description: Make better decisions by utilizing your big data.

item.title: Interactive Data visualization
item.description: Visualize your data to increase impact and understanding.

item.title: Data quality
item.description: Data is everything! Poor data quality can have a very negative impcact on your organization.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
